content.text:
Minimum lot area per dwelling unit: 50,000 square
feet.

Minimum lot width and length of street line frontage:
150 feet.
Minimum front yard: 50 feet. On a corner lot, a front yard should be provided on each street. (See § 240-54.)
Minimum side yards: 35 feet for each side yard.

A rear yard shall be provided on a corner lot,
and the owner shall have the privilege of electing which yard is to
be the rear yard.

An unattached accessory building not over one
story or 15 feet in height and located on the rear 1/3 of the lot
may be placed at a minimum distance of five feet from the property
line. On a corner lot, such accessory building shall not be located
nearer to the street line than the required minimum front yard setback
for the zoning district.

Usable open space, in square feet per dwelling
unit: 1,200.
Floor area. Minimum first floor area, in square feet.
Off-street parking spaces. As required by § 240-75 through 240-78.

Lot coverage. No buildings, accessory structures,
pools, courts, drives or paved areas shall be erected or installed
to exceed a lot coverage of 35%.[Added 7-17-1996 by L.L. No. 14-1996]
Maximum size. See § 240-59.1.[Added 1-8-2003 by L.L. No. 1-2003]

Minimum lot area per dwelling unit: 30,000 square
feet.

125 feet.
Minimum front yard: 50 feet. On a corner lot, a front yard shall be provided on each street. (See § 240-54.)

story or 15 feet in height and located on the rear 1/3 of the lot
may be placed at a minimum distance of five feet from the property

nearer to the street line than the required minimum front yard setback

A rear yard shall be provided on a corner lot,
and the owner shall have the privilege of electing which yard is to
be the rear yard.

story or 15 feet in height and located on the rear 1/3 of the lot
may be placed at a minimum distance of five feet from the property
line. On a corner lot, such accessory building shall not be located
nearer to the street line than the required minimum front yard setback
for the zoning district.

unit): 1,200.

Minimum lot area per dwelling unit: 5,000 square feet.
(Any lot existing in the R-2F Zone in single and separate ownership
on June 29, 1959, having at least 7,500 square feet, may be used for
two-family residence.)

Minimum lot width and length of street-line frontage:
50 feet per dwelling unit.[Amended 4-17-1963]
Minimum front yard: 30 feet. On a corner lot, a front yard shall be provided on each street. (See § 240-54.)

An unattached accessory building not over one
story or 15 feet in height and located on the rear one-third (1/3)

A rear yard shall be provided on a corner lot,
and the owner shall have the privilege of electing which yard is to

Least one: 25 feet.[Amended 7-17-1996 by L.L. No. 14-1996]
Total of two: 60 feet.[Amended 7-17-1996 by L.L. No. 14-1996]

Minimum front yard: 15 feet. On a corner lot, a front yard shall be provided on each street. (See § 240-54.)

One and one-half (1 1/2) inches per foot
of building height but not less than five feet or one inch for each
foot of building length, a minimum of 10 feet from a street.

An unattached accessory building not over one
story or 15 feet in height and located on the rear one-third (1/3)
of the lot may be placed at a minimum distance of five feet from the
property line. On a corner lot, such accessory building shall not
be located nearer to the street line than the required minimum front
yard setback for the zoning district.

Minimum rear yard: three inches per foot of building
height but not less than 15 feet.

A rear yard shall be provided on a corner lot,
and the owner shall have the privilege of electing which yard is to
be the rear yard.

story or 15 feet in height and located on the rear one-third (1/3)

200.

an average of 750 square feet per dwelling unit.
